text: Nomarussia Bonase (born 1966) is a South African human rights activist. In 2017, she won the Anne Klein Womenâ€™s Award. She was a union shop steward. She identified her brother's body after he was killed. She joined Khulumani Support Group after the failure of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission to address rape. She organized workshops and art therapy sessions, after the Marikana massacre. == References == Category:1966 births Category:Human rights activists Category:South African activists
title: Nomarussia Bonase
